meanings.definition: Capable of being tried in a court of law.
meanings.sent1: The case was triable, so it went to court for a decision.
meanings.sent2: The triable offense led to a legal trial.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer joked that even the most triable cases can have surprising outcomes.
meanings.sent4: Her guilt was as clear as a triable case under the law.
meanings.sent5: The judge made the triable nature of the crime evident to all.

meanings.definition: Able to be tested or evaluated.
meanings.sent1: The new medicine was triable to see if it worked.
meanings.sent2: Students find triable questions on exams to be challenging.
meanings.sent3: The scientist found a triable way to test the hypothesis.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was as triable as a lab experiment.
meanings.sent5: The triable experiment yielded unexpected results.

meanings.sent1: His actions were triable under the watchful eyes of the jury.
meanings.sent2: The triable decision was left to the experts to analyze.
meanings.sent3: The cat's curiosity made it a triable subject for observation.
meanings.sent4: The truth was as triable as a puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The triable situation demanded careful consideration.
